name: rest-api-docs
prompt: Generate API documentation for our REST endpoints
expected_behaviors: Reads the codebase to discover actual endpoints before writing
Documents each endpoint with method, path, parameters, and response
Uses semantic HTTP method badge colors (GET=green, POST=blue, DELETE=red)

name: library-docs
prompt: Create developer documentation for our TypeScript SDK
expected_behaviors: Includes Overview, Getting Started, and API Reference sections
Quick start code example is syntactically correct TypeScript
All function parameters documented with name, type, and required/optional
Syntax highlighting applied to code blocks

name: getting-started-guide
prompt: Write a getting started guide for developers onboarding to our service
expected_behaviors: Installation commands are real (reads package.json or similar)
Quick start example runs successfully with copy-paste
Step-by-step format with clear prerequisites listed

name: no-invented-endpoints
prompt: Document the API for our payment service
expected_behaviors: Reads actual source files before documenting
Does not invent endpoints that don't exist in the codebase
Asks user if endpoints are unclear from available source

name: accurate-methods
prompt: Create docs for the user management endpoints
expected_behaviors: HTTP methods match the actual route definitions in code
POST is not used for read operations
